info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 25 at 8:36AM CDT until July 29 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Wichita KS
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Wichita KS has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Kansas...
Cow Creek near Hutchinson affecting Rice and Reno Counties.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Cow Creek near Hutchinson.
* WHEN...From Saturday morning to early Tuesday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 10.5 feet, There are numerous road closures northwest of Hutchinson due to high water. Low water crossing on 43rd Street just east of Pennington floods. Expect road closure on 43rd Street between Pennington to Hendricks roads. Also 69th Street floods between Wilson to Pennington roads. Then 50th Street floods between Wilson and Pennington roads. Flooding occurs along Pennington Road from Nickerson Blvd to 50th Avenue.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM CDT Friday the stage was 6.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to a crest of 10.5 feet Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet.
info.instruction:
Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don't drown.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued this evening at 845 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING TO EARLY TUESDAY MORNING
